entry.title: Combined summary - Dynamic Hierarchical Deterministic Key Trees
entry.summary: In November 2015, Eric Lombrozo proposed a BIP to solve the issue of HD wallet structures in Bitcoin. The proposed solution aimed to simplify multidevice synchronization, key management, account structures, etc. while also allowing for privacy by making it nontrivial to associate transactions for an account without knowing the seed/chain code. They referred to such sequences by a path to the immediate parent node in the tree and reserve the children themselves for the signing keys. Tamas Blummer asked if he could use a key for both signing and derivation of a deeper level of the hierarchy, but Eric did not provide any arguments discouraging this use. Eric, a developer has submitted a BIP proposal to solve the issue of predefining HD wallet structures and nesting deeper levels in Bitcoin. The proposal is available on Github for public comments and feedback. This proposal aims to provide a solution to the limitations posed by the current structure of HD wallets in Bitcoin. The proposed solution would allow for arbitrary nesting of deeper levels, which would expand the capabilities of HD wallets in Bitcoin. Eric invites comments from the public on Github for further development.When Tamas Blummer asked Eric Lombrozo to enumerate or point to arguments that discourage the use of a key both for signing and for derivation of a deeper level of the hierarchy, Eric mentioned that he had submitted a BIP proposal that addressed the issue of needing to predefine HD wallet structures and not being able to arbitrarily nest deeper levels. The proposal can be found on GitHub (https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/242). However, Eric did not directly answer Tamas' question about discouraging the use of a key for both signing and deriving a deeper level of the hierarchy.
